tva:BasicDescription.tva:Title: Newegg TV: How To Build a Computer - Part 1 - Choosing Your Components
tva:BasicDescription.tva:Synopsis:
http://www.newegg.com
Welcome to Newegg TV's How To Build a Computer tutorial! This is Part 1, where we'll be covering the different components that make up a typical computer, as well as the different functions they perform. Also, we provide some advice on planning out your build and choosing the best parts to suit your needs.
Part 2 - Building Your Computer: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d_56kyib-Ls Part 3 - Installing an Operating System & Finishing Touches: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RxaVBsXEiok
Here are some helpful links: Newegg's Computer Hardware Store - http://bit.ly/ifmBJG Newegg's DIY PC Combo Store - http://bit.ly/malqnf Newegg's Community Forums - http://www.eggxpert.com
- Credits - Camera, Editing, Titles: Mr. Lam 20+ Minutes of Talking about PC Parts: Paul

tva:Genre.tva:Name: Non-linear audio-video

tva:HowRelated.tva:Name: Recommendation
tva:HowRelated.tva:Definition: The reference points to a resource recommended the provider of the current resource. The service provider considers there to be similarities between the currently described resource and the referenced resource. Example: This could provide access to previous or next episodes or to all episodes (the parent series as a whole). Suggestion to record a programme which the broadcaster recommends because of what the user is watching.It could also point to a Web site proposing related programmes ‘recommended’ by the service provider. A recommendation can be used to suggest content or services or services bundles with a similar subject.

tva:Review.tva:FreeTextReview: (droool) ﻿
Alright﻿ thanks :D
it was a i7 eteme and﻿ yes it was LOUD
LOL yea, I want something that will be able to run﻿ anything on 3 screens for at least 2 years.
That's because﻿ your card is old and sucks.
lol 1:34 , like a porno﻿ line
So how much was the CPU that exploded in your﻿ computer?
unless you nividia grahics card is 8 years﻿ old i highly doubt you have a fps of 30
should﻿ be fine. Have fun!
I give﻿ up with this shit, I still don't understand how to build a good computer for gaming and never will, fuck this.
Now you tell me need a new computer parts :(﻿
whats a good﻿ psu is out there i need one for my build please help.

I﻿ have picked some parts to build a pc with. Wanted to make sure they are all compatible.
Case: Thermaltake Level 10 GT Snow Edition Motherboard: ASUS Sabertooth Z77 Memory: Patriot Intel Extreme Master 16GB (4x4GB) 240 pin DDR3 1866 SSD: SAMSUNG 830 Series 2.5'' 256GB SATA III MLC SSD PSU: SeaSonic X-750 750W ATX 12V/EPS12V SLI ready 80+ Gold full modular CPU: Intel Core i7- 3770K Ivy Bridge 3.5Ghz LGA 1155 77W Quad-Core GPU: MSi N660Ti Pe 2GD5 GeForce 660 Ti 2GB 192-bit GDDR5 PCIe 3.0

Replace i7-2600k with i5-3570k.
Your RAM is very overkill, 16gb should be PLENTY for the next like﻿ 5 years.
Other than that it looks good.
You could always go onto forums and ask people what their builds are﻿ and ask them to help you decide what components to pick.
LOL.﻿

I see. Technically the CUDA cores in your GPU can do video rendering as well, which makes the hyperthreading of the i7 3770k not﻿ as valuable. The RAM for server hosting makes sense.
me personally, I would go with an i5 3570k but I don't need the hyperthreading. Sounds like u do.
Youre﻿ cpu is going to catch on fucking fire,
I﻿ chose a i7-3770k instead, and I need the RAM for server hosting (Minecraft) and I also do a'lot of video editing, but thanks :)

Guys I am super lazy and forgot to buy a cpu fan and I am going to turn it on...Its a i7 intel prossecor extreme will anything bad happen? I﻿ am really impatient and if no one responds in 2 minutes I will turn it on without fan why do i need a fan anyways?!?!
2 years? and the﻿ rest that setup is seriously top of the range

Those are all good. If you are gaming, I really do want to make a suggestion. The only difference between an i5 3570k and an i7 3770k is that the i7 3770k is 100MHz faster and has Hyperthreading. Games right now do not use Hyperthreading. If you want my advice, buy an i5 3570k which will be cooler (And overclock better) than an i7 3770k. With the $100 you save, upgrade to a GTX﻿ 670 or 680 :) Hyperthreading is good for video rendering BUT the cuda cores in your GPU do that as well.
they﻿ are all compatible (troll)
If you turn it on without a fan it will get hot and die﻿ you idiot
you must have a serious budget for that﻿
